N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 575.9 - Standards pertaining to recordkeeping

State Regulations
(a) Providers of services shall maintain
records for verification of all eligible individuals receiving community
support services, including individuals who have an eligibility waiver pursuant
to section
575.7
of this Part, in accordance
with reporting forms as prescribed by the Office of Mental Health. (b) The records of all eligible individuals
receiving community support services, including individuals who have an
eligibility waiver pursuant to section
575.7
of this Part, shall be
confidential and access shall be governed by the requirements of section
33.13
of
the Mental Hygiene Law. (c) Providers of services shall maintain records for verification of eligibility. Such records shall include but not be limited to: (1)
hospitalization history; (2)
psychiatric diagnosis; (3)
outpatient history; (4)
functional disability
assessment; (5)
residential history
or current residence for both permanent or categorical eligibility as
applicable; and
(6)
record of
receipt of supplemental security income or social security disability insurance
benefits. (d) Providers
of services shall maintain eligibility forms for an individual who is to be
served where information is incomplete or where a determination of eligibility
is not possible pursuant to section
575.6
(g) of this

Part. Such eligibility forms shall indicate that no determination of
eligibility was made. (e) Providers
of services shall maintain separate records for individuals who receive
community support services without a determination of eligibility pursuant to
section
575.6
(g) of this

Part. Such records shall include but not be limited to: (1)
the type of service delivered; (2)
the date when a service is
delivered; (3)
the location where a
service is delivered; and
(4)
the
total number of units of service delivered. (f) Providers of services shall maintain
records of all requests for waivers of eligibility criteria. (g) Core service agencies and direct contract
agencies shall maintain a centralized and current list of all eligible
individuals and those individuals whose eligibility has been waived and who are
receiving community support services. (h) Such statistical information shall be
prepared and maintained as may be necessary for the effective operation of the
community support services program and as may be required by the Office of

Mental Health. (i) Statistical
information shall be reported to the Office of Mental Health in a manner and
within time limits specified by the Office of Mental Health. (j) Statistical reporting shall be the
responsibility of an individual whose name and title shall be made known to the

Office of Mental Health. Notes
